intro: Schmidtia fruticosa, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Schmidtia fruticosa is known for its resilience to drought and salt spray, making it well adapted to harsh environments. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in gardens, particularly in coastal areas.
